articles.title: The Beauty of Group Theory
articles.description: What I learned about abstract algebra at Stanford SUMaC and why symmetry is everywhere in math.

articles.title: Rhodes Scholaring: Grammar and Power in Decolonial Speech
articles.description: An analysis of how language shapes authority and identity in academic settings (written for the university writing class at Columbia).

articles.title: What's In An Ending? Narrative Refusal in Tell Me How It Ends
articles.description: An exploration of how Valeria Luiselli refuses narrative closure in "Tell Me How It Ends" to resist the extraction and commodification of migrant children's trauma (written for the university writing class at Columbia).

articles.title: Why I Started a STEM Newsletter
articles.description: Reflections on science communication and making STEM accessible through student publishing.

projects.title: AI Sentience Testing Frameworks
projects.description: Working on new ways to think about AI sentience beyond the Turing Test. Trying to build frameworks that actually make sense from a cognitive science perspective.

projects.title: Fusion Reactor Neutronics Optimization
projects.description: Used Monte Carlo simulations in Python with OpenMC to analyze neutron behavior in fusion reactors. Found that octalithium plumbate could be a good breeding blanket materialâ€”which was pretty cool to discover.

projects.title: Student Attrition Prediction Model
projects.description: Looked at what factors influence student dropout rates using linear regression. Got published in the July issue (pages 509-519).

projects.title: Space Settlement Design Competition
projects.description: Founded my school's first INSSDC team and somehow made it to national runners-up. Coordinated 20 people and wrote a 60-page proposal for an orbital space settlement.

projects.title: Mathematical Visualization Tools
projects.description: Making interactive visualizations for abstract math using Python and Manim. Focusing on linear transformations, group theory, and topology.

projects.title: CERN Beamline for Schools
projects.description: Proposed an experiment to measure muon lifetime. Got feedback from actual CERN physicists which was honestly surreal.

experiments.title: Wikipedia Speed Run!
experiments.description: Navigate from obscure Wikipedia articles to complex topics using only internal links. Race against the clock!

experiments.title: Frequency
experiments.description: Decrypt messages using frequency analysis. A cryptography puzzle game with 10 levels of increasing difficulty.
